detaileddescription.para:
r
Range to validate or NULL.
The given range, or {0, 0} for NULL.
Will abort if range is invalid, that is a > b.

briefdescription.para: Compute the ROI for image comparisons.

detaileddescription.para:
img_a
An image.
img_b
Another image.
clip_rect
Explicit ROI, or NULL for using the whole image area.
The region of interest (ROI) that is guaranteed to be inside both images.
If clip_rect is given, it must fall inside of both images. If clip_rect is NULL, the images must be of the same size. If any precondition is violated, this function aborts with an error.
The ROI is given as pixman_box32_t, where x2,y2 are non-inclusive.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t pix_a, uint32_t pix_b, const struct range *fuzz, struct pixel_diff_stat *stat)
memberdef.name: fuzzy_match_pixels

memberdef.argsstring: (pixman_image_t *img_a, pixman_image_t *img_b, const struct rectangle *clip_rect, const struct range *prec)
memberdef.name: check_images_match

briefdescription.para: Test if a given region within two images are pixel-identical.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the two images pixel-wise identical, and false otherwise.

img_a
First image.
img_b
Second image.
clip_rect
The region of interest, or NULL for comparing the whole images.
prec
Per-channel allowed difference, or NULL for identical match required.
This function hard-fails if clip_rect is not inside both images. If clip_rect is given, the images do not have to match in size, otherwise size mismatch will be a hard failure.

The per-pixel, per-channel difference is computed as img_b - img_a which is required to be in the range [prec->a, prec->b] inclusive. The difference is signed. All four channels are compared the same way, without any special meaning on alpha channel.

src
Source pixel as x8r8g8b8.
add
The tint as x8r8g8b8, x8 must be zero; r8, g8 and b8 must be no greater than 0xc0 to avoid overflow to another channel.
The tinted pixel color as x8r8g8b8, x8 guaranteed to be 0xff.
The source pixel RGB values are divided by 4, and then the tint is added. To achieve colors outside of the range of src, a tint color channel must be at least 0x40. (0xff / 4 = 0x3f, 0xff - 0x3f = 0xc0)

memberdef.argsstring: (pixman_image_t *img_a, pixman_image_t *img_b, const struct rectangle *clip_rect, const struct range *prec)
memberdef.name: visualize_image_difference

briefdescription.para: Create a visualization of image differences.

detaileddescription.para:
img_a
First image, which is used as the basis for the output.
img_b
Second image.
clip_rect
The region of interest, or NULL for comparing the whole images.
prec
Per-channel allowed difference, or NULL for identical match required.
A new image with the differences highlighted.
Regions outside of the region of interest are shaded with black, matching pixels are shaded with green, and differing pixels are shaded with bright red.
This function hard-fails if clip_rect is not inside both images. If clip_rect is given, the images do not have to match in size, otherwise size mismatch will be a hard failure.

The per-pixel, per-channel difference is computed as img_b - img_a which is required to be in the range [prec->a, prec->b] inclusive. The difference is signed. All four channels are compared the same way, without any special meaning on alpha channel.

briefdescription.para: Write an image into a PNG file.

parameterdescription.para: The name and path for the file.

simplesect.para: true if successfully saved file; false otherwise.
Only image formats directly supported by Cairo are accepted, not all Pixman formats.

briefdescription.para: Load an image from a PNG file.

detaileddescription.para: Reads a PNG image from disk using the given filename (and path) and returns as a Pixman image. Use pixman_image_unref() to free it.
The returned image is always in PIXMAN_a8r8g8b8 format.

simplesect.para: Pixman image, or NULL in case of error.

briefdescription.para: Take screenshot of a single output.

detaileddescription.para: Requests a screenshot from the server of the output that the client appears on. This implies that the compositor goes through an output repaint to provide the screenshot before this function returns. This function is therefore both a server roundtrip and a wait for a repaint.

simplesect.para: A new buffer object, that should be freed with buffer_destroy().

memberdef.argsstring: (pixman_image_t *ref_image, struct buffer *shot, const struct rectangle *clip, const char *test_name, int seq_no, const struct range *fuzz)
memberdef.name: write_visual_diff

memberdef.argsstring: (struct buffer *shot, const char *ref_image, int ref_seq_no, const struct rectangle *clip, int seq_no)
memberdef.name: verify_image

detaileddescription.para: Compares the contents of the given shot to the given reference image over the given clip rectangle, reports whether they match to the test log, and if they do not match writes a visual diff into a PNG file and the screenshot into another PNG file named with get_test_name() and seq_no.
The shot image size and the reference image size must both contain the clip rectangle.
This function uses the pixel value allowed fuzz appropriate for GL-renderer with 8 bits per channel data.

shot
The image to be verified, usually a screenshot.
ref_image
The reference image file basename, without sequence number and .png suffix.
ref_seq_no
The reference image sequence number.
clip
The region of interest, or NULL for comparing the whole images.
seq_no
Test sequence number, for writing output files.
True if the shot matches the reference image, false otherwise.
For bootstrapping, ref_image can be NULL or the file can be missing. In that case the screenshot file is written but no comparison is performed, and false is returned.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct client *client, const char *ref_image, int ref_seq_no, const struct rectangle *clip, int seq_no)
memberdef.name: verify_screen_content

briefdescription.para: Take a screenshot and verify its contents.

detaileddescription.para: Takes a screenshot and calls verify_image() with it.

parameterdescription.para: The client, for connecting to the compositor.

simplesect.para: True if the screen contents matches the reference image, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Create a wl_buffer from a PNG file.

detaileddescription.para: Loads the named PNG file from the directory of reference images, creates a wl_buffer with scale times the image dimensions in pixels, and copies the image content into the buffer using nearest-neighbor filter.

parameterdescription.para: The client, for the Wayland connection.
The PNG file name without .png suffix.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct client *client, const struct wl_interface *iface, int version)
memberdef.name: bind_to_singleton_global

briefdescription.para: Bind to a singleton global in wl_registry.

detaileddescription.para:
client
Client whose registry and globals to use.
iface
The Wayland interface to look for.
version
The version to bind the interface with.
A struct wl_proxy, which you need to cast to the proper type.
Asserts that the global being searched for is a singleton and is found.
Binds with the exact version given, does not take compositor interface version into account.

briefdescription.para: Create a wp_viewport for the client surface.
Fill the image with the given color.

memberdef.argsstring: (pixman_color_t *tmp, uint8_t r, uint8_t g, uint8_t b)
